topic.title: Rate Encoding

body.p: The OIF-OFP protocol employs signaling of the rate in-band in the size of packets transported across a packet fabric. This is achieved by generating packets that are sized +1, 0, -1 bytes relative to a nominal configured packet size. The OIF-OFP protocol defines the algorithm for selecting the nominal configured packet size and its timing characteristics for various ODUk to ensure interoperability between OIF-OFP compliant devices.

The algorithm for selecting the nominal configured packet size has been implemented in the SDK. To properly select the nominal packet sizing for rate capture, the user must specify the maximum payload size for the fabric class in use (128B, 256B, or 512B). The datapath segment ILKN(CBRI) <> DCPB <> SAR is provisioned using the g5_api_ilkn_cbr_prov() API. The fabric class is specified via the ilkn_info.[fabric_ingress_data | fabric_egress_data].pkt_size parameter to the g5_api_ilkn_cbr_prov() API and can be one of G5_OPSA_TRAFFIC_CLASS_128, G5_OPSA_TRAFFIC_CLASS_256, or G5_OPSA_TRAFFIC_CLASS_512. The packet class in the fabric ingress direction (DIGI G5 device to ILKN to external fabric) and fabric egress direction (external fabric to DIGI G5 device) can be configured to different fabric classes although they would typically be configured to the same class.

The algorithm used to compute the nominal packet size for a given ODUk rate is specified by the ilkn_info.[fabric_ingress_data | fabric_egress_data].calc_type parameter to the g5_api_ilkn_cbr_prov() API. Supported calculator types are G5_PKT_CALC_OIF, G5_PKT_CALC_CUSTOM, and G5_PKT_CALC_CUSTOM_2. The OIF calculator is as per the OIF-OFP standard [4041]. The CALC_CUSTOM calculator implements the calculator used by the SDK for the Microsemi HyPHY class of devices which were implemented prior to ratification of the OIF standard. The CALC_CUSTOM_2 calculator is not implemented and is available to specify a user-defined calculator.
